summary: This is an email from November 30, 2018, forwarding a summary of a 2011 legal proceeding where Jeffrey Epstein petitioned to have his sex offender status reduced in New York. A New York prosecutor argued on Epstein's behalf, but the judge denied the petition, expressing astonishment at the prosecutor's actions.

keyFacts: In 2011, Jeffrey Epstein petitioned to reduce his sex offender status in New York, where he was classified as a level 3 (highest risk) offender.
A New York County District Attorney's office prosecutor argued on Epstein's behalf during the hearing.
New York Supreme Court Justice Ruth Shillingford denied the petition, expressing astonishment that a prosecutor would make such a request for a serial sex offender.
The prosecutor's argument cited that the Florida case never led to an indictment and that Epstein's underage victims failed to cooperate.
This information was being circulated via email in November 2018, referencing a Miami Herald article.
